Case reference: 2021037678.CaseDesc: On August 20, 2021, Vaughn Baumgardt was seen for the last time when he left a residence in Powell River, British Columbia. Vaughn has not been seen or heard from since.

Shoes: Black, Skater, Size 10, known to wear black DVS brand skater shoes

Case reference: 2014001521.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1972, a helicopter carrying a pilot and three passengers went missing in Lake Winnipeg. The helicopter left Thompson, Manitoba at 3:20 p.m. and was heading for Winnipeg after stopping at a number of communities. The helicopter landed at Warren's Landing at approximately 5:20 p.m., and left for Winnipeg. The pilot reported that the weather was poor and he estimated his arrival in Winnipeg at 8:00 p.m. At 5:50 p.m. there was radio contact with the pilot where he stated that he was over Poplar River. This was the last radio contact with this helicopter. The Canadian Air Search and Rescue, private aircraft and police aircraft searched until November 17, 1972 when the search was suspended until the spring of 1973. Nathan Kryger and Ian Fraser are presumed dead as a result of the helicopter crash. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2016031589.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1978, a male was witnessed to jump in front of the subway train at Sherbourne Station in Toronto. His post-mortem length was measured at 5'11", however, this measurement may not represent his actual height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix is present.

Hair: Brown, Short, Dark brown hair and a few days growth of facial hair.
Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Blue, Ingraham, had a blue dial and indicated the date.
Ring: Gold, band on his left middle finger

Case reference: 2012020024.CaseDesc: On February 24, 1995 what appeared to be a partial skull with an attached vertebra was located near a creek; just south of Highway 7, approximately 800 metres east of the Ruskin Bridge in Mission, B.C.  A DNA profile confirmed that this person was a female, and her DNA profile has been provided to every laboratory in Canada and shared with Interpol.  In August 2002, bones recovered during a search of a farm associated to Robert Pickton were confirmed to be genetically linked to this partial skull.  It is possible that this woman's family does not know that she is missing or may be under the mistaken belief that she was reported missing and there is a file open.

Case reference: 2014006149.CaseDesc: On February 7, 1971,  Selina Wallace spent the day with family and friends socializing. In the evening, Selina and friends went to a pier near the family home. The family last saw Selina on the pier with a male friend. When Selina did not return home the following day, family and community members searched the nearby area. The tidal currents near the pier are extremely strong and any person in the water could travel a great distance in a short period of time.

Scar: Right Hand, Circular scar under right thumb, outside of hand

Case reference: 2014005133.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2008, Laventus Burke was seen for the last time in St. Albans, Newfoundland and Labrador. During the time of his disappearance, Laventus had left a note for his mother indicating that he was going to travel to Alberta for work, and then would be moving to the State of Florida in the United States.

Case reference: 2014005826.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2012, the Banff RCMP were contacted by a tour company to report that Duc Dao and his son, Nguyen Dao of Vietnam did not arrive to board their bus at the scheduled time.  The two men had been staying at the Banff International Hotel and there were no personal items left in their room. The two men were due to fly back to Vietnam two days later. However, they did not board their scheduled flight and it is unknown if they returned to Vietnam.

Case reference: 2016026481.CaseDesc:
On October 2, 1970, the remains of a Caucasian male were found along Wellington County Road, near Guelph/Cambridge, Ontario. He had severe osteoarthritis in his lumbar area, which may have been painful. Found in close proximity were a yellow carpenter's pencil and a tin spectacle case. 9 various buttons were found: 1 overcoat button, 1 trouser button, 3 shirt buttons, 4 underwear buttons; and some pieces of fabric that may be from a white shirt and white socks were also recovered. 
He is believed to have been deceased for approximately 20 years.

Teeth: His teeth were in excellent condition but did have some marked wear.
Money: Six Canadian and American coins dated 1936-1945
Belt: Leather, Size 32 with a Steer's head buckle
Hat: Grey, FEDORA, Hat band, initials "J.U", "Calhoun's", " Bathersby"

Case reference: 2014002093.CaseDesc: Wilhemina (Winnie) Wanner went missing from her home on January 3rd, 1989 in Red Deer, Alberta.

Case reference: 2013000050.CaseDesc: William 'Billy' Weinbender has been missing since approximately 7:30pm on May 6th, 1994 from Winnipeg. At the time he went missing he was living in an apartment building in the North End of the city. Mr. Weinbender was last seen in the McPhillips Street and Leila Avenue area of Winnipeg.

Case reference: 2014002734.CaseDesc:
Martin Munawych was last seen the day he left a relatives residence near Lac La Biche, AB, he appeared to be happy at the time. 
It is believed that may have been travelling to Edmonton or Calgary. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2008023599.CaseDesc: Gordon Andrew Cameron was reported missing by a family member on March 26, 1993. He was last seen on February 28, at Lino's Restaurant and has not been seen or heard from since.  At the time of his disappearance he was self-employed as an auto-body repairman. His shop was located at Brule Road and Highway 2 in Kingston. Foul play is suspected in his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014006333.CaseDesc: Deanne MacNeil was last seen on video surveillance at the Mundare Liquor Store during the early morning hours of November 28, 2013.

Case reference: 2014005498.CaseDesc: David Rocque was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in October 2010.  David was last heard from by a family member in March 2010.  Prior to David's disappearance, he normally maintained contact with his family at least once a month.  He resided in Edmonton but had spent time in northern Alberta, St. Paul area.

Scar: Left Cheek, 51mm close to the eye

Case reference: 2013000058.CaseDesc: Marie-Berthe Perreault Astle Wiseman has been missing since June 26th 1975. She was last seen in her home located in the suburb of Pointe-Claire in Montreal, Quebec before mysteriously disappearring.

Case reference: 2014003882.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1991, Marcel Paquette was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec when he left in his car to visit his family in the Gaspésie region. His vehicle was located near the city of Causapscal, Quebec. Marcel is diabetic and may have memory problems.

Tattoo: Right Chest, Devil and "Renee et Marie" in text
Left Chest, Heart and "Diane" in text

Case reference: 2014003706.CaseDesc: Albert Crow and a friend attempted to cross Harrop Lake, Manitoba in a canoe despite high winds and the rough water. A second party in another canoe was ahead of Mr. Crow's and observed at one point of the crossing that the canoe was no longer visible. Searches were made of the shoreline and dragging operations of the lake were undertaken at the time without success. On October 12, 1974, the body of Mr. Crow's friend was recovered. His cause of death was later determined to be drowning. Albert Crow is presumed also dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2008000798.CaseDesc: Clare Kelly is schizophrenic, was not taking medications and was known to be despondent. She had a fascination with several relatives' deaths involving water. When picked up from Niagara Falls the previous week she said, "God told me to throw my body on the rocks to free my soul."

Coat: Blue, Bomber style parka with fur around the hood

Case reference: 2014006340.CaseDesc: On January 16, 2002 Anatoli Dibrov went out in the evening for about 1/2 hour. When he came home he appeared secretive. Mr. Dibrov went to bed that evening and that was the last time he was seen. Originally from Russia, it's possible he may have returned.

Boots: Brown, Red, Reddish/brown with red fur trim (only available in Russia)
Gloves: Brown, Grey, Brown mittens or grey gloves

Case reference: 2020040979.CaseDesc: On September 6, 2020, François Danford-Dussault was seen for the last time by his family in Gatineau, Quebec. François is known to be a solitary man who speaks French and English and travels by foot or bicycle. It is believed he may have travelled to British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014001313.CaseDesc: On August 26, 1976, at 11:00 pm, Frederick Seymour was seen for the last time as he stood outside of his residence in Ottawa, Ontario. Mr. Seymour had been seen by his neighbour.

Case reference: 2014001853.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1958, Clifford McKell and a friend were last seen having supper and told friends they were going out in the canoe. Neither of the men were considered experienced paddlers. No one witnessed the men leaving in the canoe. The following day they were reported missing by their employer when they failed to report to work. Police commenced an investigation and an air search found the overturned canoe. Paddles and safety cushions were also located. A witness who saw two men in a canoe around 8:30 pm indicated they were headed in a southerly direction and the lake was quite rough at the time. It is presumed Mr. McKell drowned.

Case reference: 2020028325.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2020, the body of a man was found on the banks of the Saint-Lawrence River in the area of Notre-Dame-des-Sept-Douleurs, Quebec.

Underwear: Cotton, Black, Fruit of the Loom brand, Boxer style
Sweater: Cotton, Black, T-Shirt, Kirkland brand, size M

Case reference: 2014004752.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2005 a man attended the Victoria Police Department and reported not seeing Belinda Cameron for over one month.  He told police Belinda had mentioned wanting to visit relatives in Vancouver and Manitoba but did not provide names to police.  This man reported sharing an intimate relationship with Belinda outside of his own marriage.  He said she was not a habitual runaway.  This man denied harming Belinda and through a Polygraph examination was determined to be honest.  The Victoria Police investigated Belinda's disappearance and determined that Belinda suffered from a mental illness, had a drug addiction and may have been a sex trade worker.  The last confirmed sighting of Belinda was at Shoppers Drug Mart at 870 Esquimalt Rd.  She failed to attend thereafter to pick up her daily medication.

Hair: Black, Long, Separated in the middle

Case reference: 2012020124.CaseDesc: On October 5, 1995, Ronald Couture was seen for the last time at approximately 7:30 a.m. when he left his home in Terrebonne, Quebec. Ronald told his wife he was heading to the south shore area of the city to look for a job. The vehicle he was driving, a white 1993 Pontiac Grand-Am bearing Quebec licence plate WGT 621, was never located. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2013000090.CaseDesc: On June 16, 1983, Nicola Michel Tola was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. He was suppose to come home and make dinner but he was never seen again by his family. His car was located at the Pie IX shopping mall.

Case reference: 2012020648.CaseDesc: Andrew Wiebe went missing from his residence in Saskatoon, SK on January 11, 1988. The vehicle he was driving at the time of his disappearance was later located abandoned in the Anglin Lake District, SK.

Case reference: 2014003846.CaseDesc: On March 1st, 1992, Blaine Prince and his friend were on a ski-doo on the river with two other friends. As they were driving on the river the lead ski-doo encountered ice that gave away however they accelerated to stronger ice. Mr. Prince and his friend were not as lucky and broke through the ice. Both men were observed hanging onto the edge of the ice however Mr. Prince soon let go and did not re-surface.

Case reference: 2006000799.CaseDesc: This adult male was seen walking on the ice on Lake Ontario. His body was later recovered from Lake Ontario, near Queens Quay.

Hair: Black, Short, Facial Stubble, Dark Eyebrows
Shirt: White, Black, T-shirt, 3/4 length, size Large, black sleeves
Blue, Grey, Plaid, Long sleeve with sleeves rolled up
Watch: Black, Bulova Set-O-Matic, Black nylon band
Jacket: Blue, Grey, Waist length, zippered vinyl hood, size Medium
Jeans: Blue, 30 inch waist, legs have been shortened

Case reference: 2014003349.CaseDesc: On March 14, 1993, Carl Berg Ellingsen was seen for the last time with his family at his residence in the East Vancouver region of British Columbia. Carl has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015035404.CaseDesc: On the morning of June 27, 2015, Curtis Wilson was seen for the last time by a friend in Kelowna, British Columbia. Mr. Wilson had travelled from Alberta to British Columbia in a black rental car, model Chrysler 200. Subsequently, the rental was recovered in an area off Cosen Bay in the Kalamakla Provincial Park in Coldstream, British Columbia.

Shirt: Black, TSHIRT, Orange logo on front of shirt
Tattoo: Right Forearm, Skull in top hat 'Wicked'; skull outer forearm
Right Forearm, Skull with snake through it, $$ signs & flaming skull
Left Chest, Eagle head; upper chest
Left Forearm, Red & black scorpion on inside forearm
Right Upper Arm , Three skulls, inside bicep
Right Upper Arm , Skull, outside bicep

Case reference: 2014001165.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2005, the body of an adult male was recovered from the lower Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 174 lbs and his length was measured at 5'6", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His teeth are stained suggesting that he may have been a smoker. He is circumcised and his appendix is present. He was not wearing any clothing or jewelry. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days prior to his recovery.

Hair: Black, Grey, Short, Straight, Trimmed moustache with a goatee
Teeth: Crowded, Upper & lower teeth crowded in front. Dental work including a gold crown on left upper 1st molar & two root canal treatments.
Scar: Left Hand, 3cm and 2 cm scars, inner wrist

Case reference: 2016034139.CaseDesc: Jessie Lobban has not been seen since June 16, 2016 when he left his residence at an unknown time. Jessie left behind his vehicle and his bicycle. This is out of character for him and his family is concerned.

Deformity: Left Little Finger, Tip bent inward
Right Little Finger, Tip bent inward

Case reference: 2014004274.CaseDesc: Frédéric Cormier was last seen on January 11, 2001, in the Vieux-Rosemont district of Montreal, Quebec. Frédéric would pick up his son once a week, but he has had no contact since this date.

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Case reference: 2014005279.CaseDesc: Brian Guberman was reported missing in July 1974. Brian owned a black and yellow 1964 Volkswagon van that has never been located.

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2008005999.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1978, Brian McLean and his co-worker, Russell Thomas, were commercial fishing at their camp on MacDowell Lake, near MacDowell Lake First Nation Territory. Mr. Thomas advised that they left in separate boats to lift nets. He went to the west side of the lake and pulled four nets, then to the east side of the lake and lifted two more nets. He then realized that Mr. McLean was not there. Mr. Thomas headed back towards the camp and found Mr. McLean’s boat washed up against the shore approximately three or four hundred metres from the camp. The motor was in forward gear with the throttle off, and the paddle was missing from the boat. MacDowell Lake is 90 "air miles" north of Red Lake, and is accessible only by air. The area was searched, and the lake was dragged, but Brian McLean has not been found.

Pants: Oilskin, Green, Coveralls with blue suspenders
Amputation: Right Foot, all toes except big toe left

Case reference: 2014005741.CaseDesc: Joseph Angus Morin had been living in Sturgeon Landing, Saskatchewan but left in December 2011, to take up residence in Wanless, MB. Joseph frequently traveled between the communities in the immediate area and was last seen in Cranberry Portage on or about January 25, 2012.

Case reference: 2016026140.CaseDesc: Amber Wilson was last seen at 9:30pm on May 15, 2016, in Edmonton's downtown area. Amber has medical issues, and she is dependent on her medication. Amber lives a high risk lifestyle, and it is out of character for her not to be in contact with her family. Her family is extremely concerned for her welfare.

Case reference: 2014002002.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1977, Gaetan Pichette was seen for the last time in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. His family and friends have not seen or heard from him since.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Arm tattoo, inscribed with "COCU"

Case reference: 2005003799.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1975, an unidentified woman was found on the beach of Confederation Park of Lake Ontario in Hamilton. Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150 lbs. however, this measurement may not represent her actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. Her appendix was not present. She may have been in the water for up to a year.

Teeth: Gold Visible, Several molar teeth are missing and she has a gold crown on her upper left premolar
Jewelry: Metal, Gold, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Gruen brand watch model N225
Gold, Gold, Ring size 6, emerald stone with small diamonds on each sides
Gold, Gold, Yellow, 14kt wedding band, Blue River brand, size 6.5
Shoes: Brown, Oxford orthopedic shoes with 1.5 inch heel

Case reference: 2014005390.CaseDesc: On November 10,  2009, Victoria Chan was seen for the last time in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Victoria was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2010000899.CaseDesc: Wilfred Bruder was last spoken to on February 28th, 2004 while talking on a pay phone at the Willow West Mall in Guelph. This mall is adjacent to the Hanlon Expressway (Hwy 6) that runs north/south through the west end of Guelph. He was depressed and said his goodbyes to his ex-wife and children.  He had a history of depression and alcholism and was drinking heavily at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2006020999.CaseDesc: Ivan Matthews was last seen when witnesses saw his sailboat out of control approximately one mile off shore near the Sand Islands in Lake Superior. It is presumed Mr. Matthews fell overboard.  He has not been seen since.

Deformity: Left Foot, club foot, sometimes uses crutches

Case reference: 2014005298.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, Hatice Corbacioglu was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.  Hatice was bound for New York State, in the USA.

Case reference: 2014001040.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1990, the remains of a man were found at the north end of the Burrard Bridge in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had several healed fractures, including one on the right side of the skull. It is estimated that he may have died sometime after May 1989.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Arm, Healed fractures on ulna and radius
Left Calf, Old fracture on fibula and tibia
Nose, Healed fracture displaced towards left side
Right Side Of Head, Old fracture right zygomatic arch
Back Of Head, Healed old fractures to right temporo occipital

Case reference: 2014003956.CaseDesc: Mary Louise Lejeune was last seen on February 23, 1991 in Montreal, Quebec. She left without notifying her family and she has not been heard from since.

Coat: Wool, Grey, Purple collar and wrists

Case reference: 2014003567.CaseDesc: On November 24, 2001, Jocelyn Gadoury was seen for the last time when he left his home in Laval, Quebec to go to his garage in Saint-Eustache, Quebec. Jocelyn has not been seen or heard from since.

Sweater: White, T Shirt, With writing "PATRON DE ZAPET"

Case reference: 2012020029.CaseDesc: Julie Derouin was reported missing to Lethbridge Police in June of 1983. There have been no confirmed sightings of Julie since January 1, 1980. Police investigations continue.

Case reference: 2014001826.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1960, Andrew Moses was last seen as he left his base camp on Brunswick Lake in Algoma County, Ontario. Andrew had left the base camp to check his trap line, which was approximately 5 miles in length near Ericson Creek. On November 13, 1960, a small search group was formed when Andrew did not return. The group located a rifle belonging to Andrew leaning against a tree. The following day, a half eaten beaver was located inside of a nearby camp on Ericson creek. The camp and trap line were searched one year later, and it revealed that it was vacant with no signs of being visited.

Case reference: 2014005457.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2010, Roosdianajati and Didik Harijanto were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roosdianajati and Didik were scheduled to work, but did not show up for their shifts.

Case reference: 2012020154.CaseDesc: This female was recovered from the Burrard Inlet, approximately 200 feet from the wharf at Versatile Pacific Shipyards.

Gloves: Synthetic, White, White dress gloves in pocket

Case reference: 2013000071.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1993, Jean-Jacques Cantin was seen for the last time in the Ahuntsic district of Montreal, Quebec. His mother went to his apartment where she found packages that were prepared for different people. His personal belongings and clothes had disappeared.

Case reference: 2006002299.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1995, remains from an unidentified man were discovered in Grenadier Pond, also known as “Duck Pond”, in High Park in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020003.CaseDesc: Kelly Rideout was reported missing to Chilliwack RCMP on August 28, 2011.  She is believed to have lived a high risk life style and her disappearance is suspicious.  Police believe that Miss Rideout was the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2014005809.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2012, Martha Kelly was last seen walking near her residence in Perth Andover, New-Brunswick. Martha suffered a brain injury in the past, leaving her at times with short term memory problems. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015011649.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1999, a black man died in a fatal road accident in Montreal in the Ahuntsic district. This person would have been approximately 25 years old.

Pants: Blue, White, "Puma" written on the left thigh
Coat: Blue, White, plaid with a gray hood

Case reference: 2014002802.CaseDesc: Gérard Sabourin was last seen around noon on August 7, 1975 when he left his furniture factory business on Saint-Nicolas Street in Laval, Quebec. His vehicle was found on Champlain Blvd. in Montreal, Quebec on August 19, 1975. Gérard has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: False, No teeth, wears upper and lower dental prostheses
Shirt: Black, Orange, Black with orange flowers

Case reference: 2017014429.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1982 the body of a man was recovered from the Bow River in Calgary, Alberta. The individual had multiple fingers amputated and had an unhealed break in his right arm.

Shirt: Yellow, Black, TSHIRT, Number 38 on front in black letters
Jacket: Beige, Blue, ZIPUP, Blue plaid inside
Denim, Blue, Sheepskin lining, snaps on front
Scar: Left Little Finger, On distal end of palmar side
Right Side Of Head, 3 cm long on right front parietal region
Tattoo: Left Hand, "F" between forefinger and thumb
Mark: Left Thigh, Biopsy site mid left femur
Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Forearm, Healing fracture of distal ulna
Amputation: Left Hand, Amputation through base of thumb
Left Hand, Amputation through PIP joint on the 2nd through 5th fingers
Right Hand, Amputation through PIP joint on the 2nd through 5th fingers

Case reference: 2012020050.CaseDesc: Shirley Lonethunder originally from White Bear First Nation near Carlyle, SK went missing from downtown Saskatoon, SK on the afternoon of December 24, 1991.

Case reference: 2006019799.CaseDesc: Anthony Evans was last seen on Jarvis Lake on June 12, 1984.  He fell from the boat he was in and his body has not been recovered.

Boots: Leather, Brown, Steel toe work boots

Case reference: 2006023799.CaseDesc: On July 12, 1999, Jerzy Ryglewicz was last seen at a gas station in Merrickville. He has not been seen or made contact with any friends or family since.

Case reference: 2016008383.CaseDesc: On December 18, 2015, Adam Kazibwe was last seen at his school in Brampton.  It is believed that on February 18, 2016, Adam's mother Rosemarie Tumusiime and father Robert Kazibwe, travelled from Brampton to Kabale, Uganda with their twin children Adam and Destiny.  Further investigation has not been able to confirm the well-being of Adam or of his sister Destiny.

Case reference: 2014001408.CaseDesc: On September 13th, 1997, two fishermen failed to show up at their final destination and as a result they were reported missing to police. An immediate search of the lake was conducted and one of the men was found alive on a island. HUNTER was never found.

Case reference: 2019015016.CaseDesc: On March 14, 2019, at approximately 5:30 am, Monica Duah was seen for the last time by her friends at her work place in Toronto, Ontario. She failed to show up to work for her scheduled shifts.

Case reference: 2006005599.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1980, Foster Bezanson departed the Abitibi Road 48 area near Cochrane, Ontario to go hunting.  Mr. Bezanson failed to return and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2015019929.CaseDesc: On April 16, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Sribavan Kandasamy was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2015049567.CaseDesc: Raymond Chalifoux was last seen on May 25th, 2015 at the Fort St John Hospital. Mr. Chalifoux received abdominal surgery and left the hospital against the advice of medical staff. He left in an unknown direction. Extensive searches were conducted with negative results. Mr. Chalifoux has not been seen or heard from since.

Vest: Black, Black vest with designs on chest

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2014005200.CaseDesc: Conrad Hastings was last seen at the bus shelter at Smith Street and Portage Avenue.  His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2008000799.CaseDesc: On August 26th, 1986 Terry FIELD and Linda BLACKWELL left Lost Nation Airport, east of Cleveland, Ohio en route to Brantford Municipal Airport, Brantford, Ontario.  The plane was 18 minutes into its flight when the pilot communicated with Cleveland Air Traffic Control that they were encountering severe turbulence.  They requested new vectors to fly. The pilot was advised to turn west, then Air Traffic Control lost radio and radar contact with the plane. Debris from the plane was located on August 27, 1986 in Lake Erie, approximately 32 nautical miles south of the St.Thomas Airport. Debris was drifting in a southeast direction and was recovered approximately 1-3 nautical miles on the Canadian side of the international boundary line in Lake Erie. Debris was identified by Bud FIELD,  brother of Terry FIELD, as having come from the missing aircraft.

Case reference: 2006018999.CaseDesc: Sean MacIntyre was 13 years old at the time of a boating accident on July 25, 1980. The boat he was in started to take on water just after leaving Cockburn Island. The boat sank quickly in Lake Huron, North Channel, 2 kilometres Southwest of Bigsby Island. Occupants of the boat put on life jackets. Sean slipped out of his life jacket and is presumed  drowned. His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014005473.CaseDesc: Shayne Murray Robinson was last seen in Celista, British Columbia on July 23, 2010. On July 24, 2010 the vehicle that he drove was found abandoned near Barriere on Hwy 5, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2012020145.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2008, the remains of a man were found floating in the Fraser River near the eastern end of Dyke Road in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had suffered from severe coronary artery disease and it is likely that he may have died a few months to a year prior to the discovery of his remains.

Teeth: False, This person wore complete upper and lower dentures. These "false teeth" were very badly worn.

Case reference: 2014001190.CaseDesc: In June, 1997, the body of a male was found floating in Malpeque Harbour, Prince Edward Island. The man was buried without ever having been identified. In 2010 the remains were exhumed so that a facial approximation could be completed by a forensic artist. Subsequent media publicity has failed to identify the man. His physical descriptors do not match missing persons from the Atlantic Canada region.

Case reference: 2013000026.CaseDesc: John Antic's wife spoke with him at 11:00 a.m. on November 5, 2012 at a local Burlington mall. Mr. Antic left the mall wearing appropriate clothing for the weather. At approximately 7:30 p.m., Mrs. Antic received a phone call from a woman on behalf of Mr. Antic. She could hear her husband in the background saying he was eating dinner at a restaurant in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Mr. Antic's presence at the restaurant was confirmed. It is believed that he was on foot, and is familiar with public transportation. Mr. Antic has had no contact with his family or banking institutions since. There were no pre-existing medical, domestic or mental health issues.

Hair: Grey, Short, Short hair on sides and balding across top
Hat: Black, A black flat topped hat with a brim at front.  No markings.

Case reference: 2020048673.CaseDesc: On September 27, 2020, Geoffrey Irwin was last seen on a Royal Bank of Canada surveillance camera in Langford, British Columbia and has not been seen since. On November 25th,2020, Geoffrey Irwin's black 2017 Ford Escape was located at Park Royal Mall in West Vancouver, British Columbia. Geoffrey is known to travel between the West Shore and the Lower Mainland.

Backpack: Nylon, Black, Grey, Black with grey stripes, with zipper
Shorts: Synthetic, Brown, Taupe or light brown colour with pockets, size large
Jacket: Cotton, Grey, Hooded with white drawstrings

Case reference: 2016017728.CaseDesc: Reid Chesney left a men's shelter in Halifax, Nova Scotia on April 4, 2016. Mr. Chesney lived a transient lifestyle and had very little communication with family members. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2017047772.CaseDesc: On August 15, 2017, Moacir Ferrari was seen for the last time leaving his home with his belongings in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014046775.CaseDesc: On November 10, 2014, at approximately 2:00 p.m., Sofia Touila was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sofia had told her friend that she would be going home but did not return.

Case reference: 2020008538.CaseDesc: In mid-June 1976, Peter Vollar was last seen by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario. Peter had advised he was heading to London, Ontario for two weeks to seek job opportunities. All of his personal belongings were left behind.

Case reference: 2006010299.CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.

Case reference: 2014004137.CaseDesc: On the night of October 5, 1976, Jean-Luc Ringuette was seen for the last time when he left his home in Sainte-Anne-de-Madawaska, New Brunswick. The following morning, Jean-Luc did not attend school. A few weeks prior to his disappearance, he had disclosed that he had some money, and that he and a friend were going to leave town.

Case reference: 2019050899.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1975, the remains of an elderly man of a small stature were found in Stanley Park in Vancouver, British Columbia. He is believed to have died of a drug overdose approximately a week before he was found.

Case reference: 2014005156.CaseDesc: On October 15, 2002, Jeanne Ouellette was seen for the last time at a Starbucks coffeehouse in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000022.CaseDesc: Mr. Shenchiu "Andy" Tsou was last seen at the Halifax Casino on June 26, 2005. He was known as a regular client at the Casino. Mr. Tsou was travelling from Richmond BC.

Case reference: 2006013299.CaseDesc: Thomas Hesse was last seen on September 2, 1989 in Moonbeam Township, near Cochrane, Ontario.  He was riding a Raleigh, 3-speed, gold coloured, lady's bicycle.  Mr. Hesse left his parents' house in a depressed state and may have been suicidal.

Case reference: 2012020038.CaseDesc: Desiree Oldwoman was last seen near her home on the Siksika Fist Nations Reserve near Gleichen, Alberta. She is autistic and does not speak, although she can write her name. Ms. Oldwoman was last seen on August 27, 2011.

Case reference: 2020011116.CaseDesc: Glen Peddle had been hitchhiking through the United States between 1982 and 1985. In April 1985, Glen called his mother from New York to tell her that he was planning on returning home to Newfoundland in the spring, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2014001462.CaseDesc: Gareth Austin was last seen on August 17, 1995, and was last known to be in Medicine Hat, Alberta with Dominic Park.

Scar: Left Hand, Scar top of left hand

Case reference: 2012020044.CaseDesc: Rodney Sloat was last seen by friends, while having dinner at their residence. His friend indicated that he was despondent when he left on his snowmobile at around midnight. He was invited to spend Christmas with his friends, but did not go. Mr. Sloat was reported missing by his family several days later. His snowmobile, all of his possessions, and his identification were found at his home.

Case reference: 2010000599.CaseDesc: Bradley Allan Taylor was on his way home to Enfield, Nova Scotia from London, Ontario. He spent the night in Brockville, Ontario at the Travelodge Motel.  On January 10, 2009, he left the motel in the morning and later that day police found his car abandoned near a railway crossing in Roussillon, Quebec. Many of his personal belongings were found in the car. Police searched the area but Mr. Taylor was not located.

Hair: Brown, Long, Straight, Beard, Moustache, Sideburns

Case reference: 2014003849.CaseDesc: On September 16, 1998, Jocelyne Boardman was seen for the last time when she left a friend's residence in the Verdun District in Montreal, Quebec, to return to her home in Kingston, Ontario. Jocelyne is known to only wear black clothing and she hasn't been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005821.CaseDesc: Jacques Joseph Duguay was reported missing on May 31, 1982. On May 25th, 1982, his vehicle, a 1975 Chev 1/2 ton pickup was towed from Berry Mills Highway just outside Moncton, NB. The vehicle had been there since May 21st, 1982.

Case reference: 2005002499.CaseDesc: On March 23, 1987, a black male was found on the shoreline of the Holly Bay Lodge (Lot 8, Con. 12, Dover Township) in Mitchell's Bay of Lake St. Clair, Wallaceburg. He may have been a smoker. He is believed to have been dead for approximately 8 months.

Money: coins, most recent 1985, distributed after March
Shoes: Blue, Grey, running shoes "Winner" brand, size 8 with velcro fasteners
Socks: Cotton, White, red and blue stripes at the top
Other: May have suffered from lower back pain

Case reference: 2014004807.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1988, Ronald Gerard Cole went missing. He has not been heard from by family or friends since then. He was a resident of Warren, Ontario.

Case reference: 2015011630.CaseDesc: On June 9, 2000, a man's body was recovered from the St. Lawrence River near Boucherville Islands by the nautical patrol team.

Boots: Leather, Brown, "Georgia Giant" brand, steel toe boots

Case reference: 2009002799.CaseDesc: Terry Zubko was a resident of Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario and had been a patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital. Terry left the hospital on July 21, 1982, at 10:00 AM. It is unknown what his diagnosis was at the time, however, reports indicate he suffers from amnesia that requires medication. He was last seen at the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital (which became the Northeast Mental Health Centre, before being torn down in 2013)

Shirt: May have been wearing a white pullover type shirt
Pants: May have been wearing brown corduroy pants or blue jeans

Case reference: 2014002841.CaseDesc: Michel Gagné was last seen on June 29, 1982, in Montreal, QC. Mr. Gagné left his friend's mother's home to go with him to a medical clinic. He has not been seen since.
